```{r, echo=TRUE}
library(epiDisplay)
library(dplyr)
library(data.table)
# Connecting with Opal data server
## Login to server and assign study data
#Load Opal R library
library(opal)
# Create an opal object with the login information
erasmus_opal <- opal.login()
#Login to Opal server and assign the content of the GLOBE table(s) to your RStudio environment
# GLOBE1991
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'GLOBE1991', 'GLOBE.GLOBE1991',variables = list('v156','v169','v167','v168','v173','v174','v175','v172','v155','v156','v335','SEGVv460','SEGVv461','SEGVv462','SEGVv454','SEGVv455','SEGVv456','SEGVv475','SEGVv476','SEGVv477','SEGVv472','SEGVv473','SEGVv474','SEGVv457','SEGVv458','SEGVv459','v167','v168','v169','v170','v171','v172','v173','v174','v175','v167'))
GLOBE1991 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'GLOBE1991')
# GLOBE1997
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'GLOBE1997', 'GLOBE.GLOBE1997',variables = list('v11c','v11a','v11b','v11g','v11h','v11i','v11f','g29a','g9c1','g9c2','g9c3','g9a2','g9a3','g9a1','g9g1','g9g2','g9g3','g9f1','g9f2','g9f3','g9b1','g9b2','g9b3','v11a','v11b','v11c','v11d','v11e','v11f','v11g','v11h','v11i','v11a'))
GLOBE1997 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'GLOBE1997')
# GLOBE2004
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'GLOBE2004', 'GLOBE.GLOBE2004',variables = list('w266','w264','w265','w270','w271','w272','w269','w072b','w051','w040a','w041','w289','w264','w265','w266','w267','w268','w269','w270','w271','w272','w072b','w051','w264','w072a'))
GLOBE2004 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'GLOBE2004')
# GLOBE2011
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'GLOBE2011', 'GLOBE.GLOBE2011',variables = list('v49_buurt_wndr','53_b_buur2','v50_huis_bez','v61_c_o_vak','v61_d_o_pol','v61_e_o_ker','v61_f_o_buu','v61_g_o_ner','v59_f_ond6','v61_d_o_pol','v61_c_o_vak','v61_f_o_buu','v61_g_o_ner','v61_b_o_hob','v49_buurt_wndr','v53_b_buur2','v59_a_ond1'))
GLOBE2011 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'GLOBE2011')
# GLOBE2014
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'GLOBE2014', 'GLOBE.GLOBE2014',variables = list('G14v9','G14v87','G14v90_g','G14v88','G14v42','G14v46','G14v54','G14v55','G14v36','G14v40','G14v59_f','G14v56_e','G14v56_g','G14v56_c','G14v56_d','G14v56_f','G14v56_h','G14v56_b','G14v87','G14v90_g','G14v45','G14v59_a'))
GLOBE2014 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'GLOBE2014')
```
## Assign participant id as first column of your harmonized dataframes
```{r, echo=FALSE}
soc_GLOBE_0 <- data.frame(id = GLOBE1991$id )
soc_GLOBE_1 <- data.frame(id = GLOBE1997$id )
soc_GLOBE_2 <- data.frame(id = GLOBE2004$id )
soc_GLOBE_3 <- data.frame(id = GLOBE2011$id )
soc_GLOBE_4 <- data.frame(id = GLOBE2014$id )
```
## When you are done with your work, logout of Opal server
```{r, echo=FALSE}
opal.logout(erasmus_opal) 
```

### **Variable label**:   Ranked network size of children         
**Variable name**:   soc_sn_children_rank_0      
**Variable description**:  Indicator of whether the participant has a low, medium or high network size compromised of children. It is measured by ranking the size of the network which is comprised of any type of child (biological, step, adoptive, foster, in-law son/daughter).  Low rank indicates no children.  Note: cohorts inquire about different types of children due to the particular questionnaire used, therefore a childless respondent in one study would not necessarily be considered childless in another study.  
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:      
**Category coding**:   

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |  Low rank of network size comprised of children (childless) 
1 |  Medium rank of network size comprised of children  (1 or 2 children)
2 |  Large rank of network size comprised of children  (more than 2 children) 

**Harmonization status**:  complete   
**Harmonization comment**:  GLOBE item does not specify alive/dead or biological/adopted/foster child.  
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
soc_GLOBE_0$soc_sn_children_rank_0 <- ifelse(GLOBE1991$v335=='0',0L, 
                                             ifelse(GLOBE1991$v335=='1' | GLOBE1991$v335=='2',1L,
                                                    ifelse(GLOBE1991$v335 >'2',2L, NA)))
```

# Social support subdomain

### **Variable label**: Received emotional support    
**Variable name**:   soc_ss_received_emo_0 
**Variable description**:  Indicator of the frequency of received emotional support i.e. receiving affection from or sharing personal experiences/feelings with, from the participant’s three social network members that they indicated they are closest to.        
**Value type**: integer   
**Variable unit**:  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |  Never received emotional support
1 |  Sometimes received emotional support
2 |  Often received emotional support

**Harmonization status**:  complete     
**Harmonization comment**: Receiving support from any 1 of 3 confidants is categorized as often receiving support, otherwise receiving support sometimes from any 1 of 3 confidants is categorized as sometimes receiving support. Study specific variable asks 'Do you get affection from this person, does this person embrace or kiss you or give you an affectionate handshake?', which might be interpreted as physical not emotional affection by perticipants. 
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
soc_GLOBE_0$soc_ss_received_emo_0 <- ifelse(GLOBE1991$SEGVv460 ==3 | GLOBE1991$SEGVv461 ==3 |GLOBE1991$SEGVv462 == 3, 2L, 
                                         ifelse(GLOBE1991$SEGVv460 ==2 | GLOBE1991$SEGVv461 ==2 |GLOBE1991$SEGVv462 == 2, 1L, 
                                             ifelse(GLOBE1991$SEGVv460 <=1 | GLOBE1991$SEGVv461 <=1 |GLOBE1991$SEGVv462 <=1, 0L, NA)))
 
```

### **Variable label**: Perceived emotional support Z-score   
**Variable name**:   soc_ss_Zscore_perceived_emo_0      
**Variable description**:  Z-score of perceived emotional support.   
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  
**Category coding**:  

**Harmonization status**:  complete   
**Harmonization comment**:   The following GLOBE items were used: Would this person give good advice? Would you be able to go to this person in tears? Do you see that this person cares for you? - averaged over the top 3 contacts. Each item is rated 1 (never) to 3 (always) hence maximum score is out of 9 which was then converted into a Z-score in order to be comparable with items in other studies which might not use 3 separate items to create this DataSchema.   
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
GLOBE1991$soc_ss_Zscore_perceived_emo_0_inter <- as.numeric(GLOBE1991$SEGVv475 + GLOBE1991$SEGVv476 + GLOBE1991$SEGVv477
                                                             + GLOBE1991$SEGVv472 + GLOBE1991$SEGVv473 + GLOBE1991$SEGVv474
                                                             + GLOBE1991$SEGVv457 + GLOBE1991$SEGVv458 + GLOBE1991$SEGVv459)


soc_GLOBE_0$soc_ss_Zscore_perceived_emo_0 <-as.numeric(scale(GLOBE1991$soc_ss_Zscore_perceived_emo_0_inter, center = TRUE, scale= TRUE)) 

```
